Imagine texting your computer like you text a friendâ€”and it actually listens, responds, and gets things done. Welcome to Clawdbot AI.

What is Clawdbot AI? ğŸŒŸ

Clawdbot (now known as OpenClaw AI due to trademark considerations) is an open-source, self-hosted personal AI assistant that fundamentally reimagines how we interact with our computers. Instead of sitting in front of a terminal or using complex interfaces, you simply message your AI assistant through familiar chat apps like WhatsApp or Telegram.

Created by Peter Steinberger and launched in late 2025, this revolutionary tool operates on a "messaging-first" principleâ€”treating the AI as a contact in your chat app that can control your computer, execute commands, and automate tasks remotely.

The best interface is the one you already use every day.

Key Capabilities ğŸš€

ğŸ–¥ï¸ Remote Terminal Access

Execute shell commands and manage local projects via chat. Whether you're on your phone at a coffee shop or traveling abroad, your development environment is just a message away.

```
You: "Run npm install and start the dev server"
Clawdbot: "âœ… Dependencies installed. Dev server running at localhost:3000"
```

ğŸ’» Coding CLI

Scaffold apps, run build tools (npm, pip, etc.), and debug logs remotely. It's like having a senior developer in your pocket who never sleeps.

- Create new projects with a single message

- Run tests and get instant feedback

- Debug logs and fix issues on the fly

ğŸ§  Long-term Memory

Unlike typical AI interactions, Clawdbot remembers your preferences and context across conversations. It learns your workflow, your common commands, and your project structures.

ğŸ”” Proactive Notifications

Set up background tasks and receive alerts when they complete. Imagine getting a WhatsApp notification when your long-running build finishes or when your server goes down.

ğŸ“ File System Interaction

Read, write, and modify files on your host machine. Need to quickly edit a config file while away from your desk? Just ask.

Why Self-Hosted Matters ğŸ 

In an era of data privacy concerns, Clawdbot takes a local-first approach. By running on your own devices or servers:

- Your data stays yours - No third-party servers see your commands or files

- Full control - Customize, extend, and modify the codebase

- No subscription anxiety - The software is free (you only pay for AI API costs)

- Works offline - Local operations continue even without internet

Getting Started ğŸ› ï¸

Prerequisites

- Node.js: v18 or later (v22+ recommended)

- Git

Installation

Run the official installer with a single command:

```bash
curl -fsSL https://clawd.bot/install.sh | bash
```

Or install via npm:

```bash
npm i -g clawdbot
```

Quick Setup

```bash
# Start the interactive onboarding
clawdbot onboard

# Start the Gateway (bridges AI to messaging)
clawdbot gateway --port 18789 --verbose
```

Messaging Platform Integration ğŸ“±

WhatsApp Setup

1. Run: clawdbot login

2. A QR code appears in your terminal

3. Open WhatsApp â†’ Settings â†’ Linked Devices â†’ Link a Device

4. Scan the QR code

Note: Authentication may need refresh every 20 days.

Telegram Setup

1. Open Telegram and message @BotFather

2. Create a new bot using /newbot

3. Copy the HTTP API Token provided

4. Provide this token during clawdbot onboard

Real-World Use Cases ğŸ’¡

| Scenario | How Clawdbot Helps |

|----------|-------------------|

| Deploy from anywhere | "Deploy the staging branch to production" |

| Monitor services | "Alert me if the API response time exceeds 500ms" |

| Quick file edits | "Change DEBUG=false to DEBUG=true in .env" |

| Check system status | "What's the current CPU and memory usage?" |

| Schedule tasks | "Run the backup script every night at 2 AM" |

Security Considerations âš ï¸

âš ï¸ Important: Clawdbot gives an AI agent (and anyone with access to your enabled chat accounts) significant control over your computer's terminal and file system.

Best Practices:

- ğŸ–¥ï¸ Run in a VM or VPS - Don't use your primary personal machine

- ğŸ”’ Isolate sensitive data - Keep critical files away from the Clawdbot environment

- ğŸ“Š Monitor activity - Regularly check Gateway logs

- ğŸ”‘ Secure your messaging accounts - Enable 2FA on WhatsApp/Telegram

Cost Considerations ğŸ’°

The Clawdbot software itself is free and open-source. However, you'll need to cover:

- AI API costs: $5-$150/month depending on usage (Anthropic Claude, OpenAI GPT, etc.)

- Server costs: Free tier available (AWS, DigitalOcean, etc.) or run locally

ğŸ’¡ Tip: Start with a free-tier AWS instance to test the waters before committing to a dedicated VPS.

The Future of Personal Computing ğŸ”®

Clawdbot represents a paradigm shift in how we think about computer interaction. Instead of adapting to complex interfaces, our computers adapt to our most natural form of communicationâ€” messaging.

As AI capabilities continue to evolve, tools like Clawdbot will become increasingly powerful, handling not just simple commands but complex workflows, decision-making, and proactive assistance.
